newsitem.title: USA: Grand Casinos directors leave Statosphere board.
newsitem.headline: Grand Casinos directors leave Statosphere board.

text.p: Grand Casinos Inc said Thursday that Lyle Berman, Stanley Taube and Neil Sell, all members of Grand Casinos' board of directors, have resigned from the board of bankrupt hotel operator Statosphere Corp.

The Grand Casinos directors resigned from the Stratosphere board to avoid conflicts of interest arising from Stratosphere's decision that a restructuring proposal recently presented to Stratosphere by High River Limited Partnership and American Real Estate Partners L.P. was more favorable than the restructuring proposal previously agreed to between Grand and Stratosphere.
Grand Casinos owns 42 percent of Stratosphere's common stock and holds $50 million in subordinated Stratosphere debt.

Grand Casinos said it plans to continue to explore with Stratosphere and the official committee of Stratosphere noteholders alternatives for an agreed on reorganization of Stratosphere, including the possibility of amending Grand's previous restructuring proposal.

If an alternative consensual arrangement cannot be reached, however, Grand Casinos may propose or participate in alternative plans of reorganization or may terminate altogether its participation in the Stratosphere bankruptcy process, the cvompany said.
Grand Casinos shares were down 4/16 ast 15-11/16 Thursday.
